00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextLimitedVector.pl - Allow vector entry but now vector operations.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements a context in which vectors can be entered,
00024 but no vector operations are permitted.  So students will
00025 be able to perform operations within the coordinates
00026 of the vectors, but not between vectors.
00027 
00028 Vectors can still be entered either in < , , > or ijk format.
00029 Most of the complication here is to handle ijk format
00030 properly.  Each coordinate vector is allowed to appear
00031 only once, so we have to keep track of that, and allow
00032 SOME vector operations, but only when one term is
00033 one of the coordinate constants, or one of the formulas
00034 we've already OKed.
00035 
00036 You control which format to use by setting the context
00037 to one of the following:
00038 
00039      Context("LimitedVector-coordinate");
00040      Context("LimitedVector-ijk");
00041      Context("LimitedVector");      # either one
00042 
00043 =cut
00044 
00045 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00046 
00047 sub _contextLimitedVector_init {LimitedVector::Init()}; # don't load it again
00048 
00049 ##################################################
00050 #
00051 #  Handle common checking for BOPs
00052 #
00053 package LimitedVector::BOP;
00054 
00055 #
00056 #  Do original check and then if the operands are numbers, its OK.
00057 #  Otherwise, check if there is a duplicate constant from either term
00058 #  Otherwise, do an operator-specific check for if vectors are OK.
00059 #  Otherwise report an error.
00060 #
00061 sub _check {
00062   my $self = shift;
00063   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/LimitedVector/Parser/;
00064   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00065   return if $self->checkNumbers;
00066   if ($self->context->{flags}{vector_format} ne 'coordinate') {
00067     $self->checkConstants($self->{lop});
00068     $self->checkConstants($self->{rop});
00069     return if $self->checkVectors;
00070   }
00071   my $bop = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{bop};
00072   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers",$bop)
00073     if $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{vector_format} eq 'coordinate';
00074   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers or i,j and k",$bop);
00075 }
00076 
00077 #
00078 #  filled in by subclasses
00079 #
00080 sub checkVectors {return 0}
00081 
00082 #
00083 #  Check if a constant has been repeated
00084 #  (we maintain a hash that lists if one is below us in the parse tree)
00085 #
00086 sub checkConstants {
00087   my $self = shift; my $op = shift;
00088   my $duplicate = '';
00089   if ($op->class eq 'Constant') {
00090     return unless $op->{name} =~ m/^[ijk]$/;
00091     $duplicate = $op->{name} if $self->{ijk}{$op->{name}};
00092     $self->{ijk}{$op->{name}} = 1;
00093   } else {
00094     foreach my $x ('i','j','k') {
00095       $duplicate = $x if $self->{ijk}{$x} && $op->{ijk}{$x};
00096       $self->{ijk}{$x} = $self->{ijk}{$x} || $op->{ijk}{$x};
00097     }
00098   }
00099   Value::Error("The constant '%s' may appear only once in your formula",$duplicate)
00100     if $duplicate;
00101 }
00102 
00103 ##############################################
00104 #
00105 #  Now we get the individual replacements for the operators
00106 #  that we don't want to allow.  We inherit everything from
00107 #  the original Parser::BOP class, and just add the
00108 #  vector checks here.
00109 #
00110 
00111 package LimitedVector::BOP::add;
00112 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::BOP Parser::BOP::add);
00113 
00114 sub checkVectors {
00115   my $self = shift;
00116   return (($self->{lop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{lop}->class =~ m/[BU]OP/) &&
00117           ($self->{rop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{rop}->class =~ m/[BU]OP/));
00118 }
00119 
00120 ##############################################
00121 
00122 package LimitedVector::BOP::subtract;
00123 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::BOP Parser::BOP::subtract);
00124 
00125 sub checkVectors {
00126   my $self = shift;
00127   return (($self->{lop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{lop}->class =~ m/[BU]OP/) &&
00128           ($self->{rop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{rop}->class =~ m/[BU]OP/));
00129 }
00130 
00131 ##############################################
00132 
00133 package LimitedVector::BOP::multiply;
00134 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::BOP Parser::BOP::multiply);
00135 
00136 sub checkVectors {
00137   my $self = shift;
00138   return (($self->{lop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{lop}->type eq 'Number') &&
00139       ($self->{rop}->class eq 'Constant' || $self->{rop}->type eq 'Number'));
00140 }
00141 
00142 ##############################################
00143 
00144 package LimitedVector::BOP::divide;
00145 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::BOP Parser::BOP::divide);
00146 
00147 sub checkVectors {
00148   my $self = shift;
00149   my $bop = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{bop};
00150   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers",$bop);
00151 }
00152 
00153 ##############################################
00154 ##############################################
00155 #
00156 #  Now we do the same for the unary operators
00157 #
00158 
00159 package LimitedVector::UOP;
00160 
00161 sub _check {
00162   my $self = shift;
00163   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/LimitedVector/Parser/;
00164   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00165   return if $self->checkNumber;
00166   if ($self->context->{flags}{vector_format} ne 'coordinate') {
00167     LimitedVector::BOP::checkConstants($self,$self->{op});
00168     return if $self->checkVector;
00169   }
00170   my $uop = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{uop};
00171   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers",$uop)
00172     if $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{vector_format} eq 'coordinate';
00173   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers or i,j and k",$uop);
00174 }
00175 
00176 sub checkVector {return 0}
00177 
00178 ##############################################
00179 
00180 package LimitedVector::UOP::plus;
00181 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::UOP Parser::UOP::plus);
00182 
00183 sub checkVector {return shift->{op}->class eq 'Constant'}
00184 
00185 ##############################################
00186 
00187 package LimitedVector::UOP::minus;
00188 our @ISA = qw(LimitedVector::UOP Parser::UOP::minus);
00189 
00190 sub checkVector {return shift->{op}->class eq 'Constant'}
00191 
00192 ##############################################
00193 ##############################################
00194 #
00195 #  Absolute value does vector norm, so we
00196 #  trap that as well.
00197 #
00198 
00199 package LimitedVector::List::AbsoluteValue;
00200 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List::AbsoluteValue);
00201 
00202 sub _check {
00203   my $self = shift;
00204   $self->SUPER::_check;
00205   return if $self->{coords}[0]->type eq 'Number';
00206   $self->Error("Vector norm is not allowed in this context");
00207 }
00208 
00209 ##############################################
00210 
00211 package LimitedVector::List::Vector;
00212 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List::Vector);
00213 
00214 sub _check {
00215   my $self = shift;
00216   $self->SUPER::_check;
00217   return if $self->context->{flags}{vector_format} ne 'ijk';
00218   $self->Error("Vectors must be given in the form 'ai+bj+ck' in this context");
00219 }

00222 ##############################################
00223 
00224 package LimitedVector;
00225 
00226 sub Init {
00227   #
00228   #  Build the new context that calls the
00229   #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00230   #
00231 
00232   my $context = $main::context{LimitedVector} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Vector");
00233   $context->{name} = "LimitedVector";
00234   $context->operators->set(
00235      '+' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::add'},
00236      '-' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::subtract'},
00237      '*' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::multiply'},
00238     '* ' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::multiply'},
00239     ' *' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::multiply'},
00240      ' ' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::multiply'},
00241      '/' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::divide'},
00242     ' /' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::divide'},
00243     '/ ' => {class => 'LimitedVector::BOP::divide'},
00244     'u+' => {class => 'LimitedVector::UOP::plus'},
00245     'u-' => {class => 'LimitedVector::UOP::minus'},
00246   );
00247   #
00248   #  Remove these operators and functions
00249   #
00250   $context->operators->undefine('_','U','><','.');
00251   $context->functions->undefine('norm','unit');
00252   $context->lists->set(
00253     AbsoluteValue => {class => 'LimitedVector::List::AbsoluteValue'},
00254     Vector        => {class => 'LimitedVector::List::Vector'},
00255   );
00256   #
00257   #  Format can be 'coordinate', 'ijk', or 'either'
00258   #
00259   $context->flags->set(vector_format => 'either');
00260 
00261   #########################
00262 
00263   $context = $main::context{'LimitedVector-ijk'} = $main::context{LimitedVector}->copy;
00264   $context->flags->set(vector_format => 'ijk');
00265 
00266   #########################
00267 
00268   $context = $main::context{'LimitedVector-coordinate'} = $main::context{LimitedVector}->copy;
00269   $context->flags->set(vector_format => 'coordinate');
00270   $context->constants->undefine('i','j','k');
00271 
00272   #########################
00273 
00274   main::Context("LimitedVector");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00275 }
